intro: Pycnandra longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered pycnandra, is a flowering plant native to certain parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody structure, typical of many plants in the Rubiaceae family. The plant produces small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
